results.description: Scottish League Two club Queen's Park will decide whether to end their 152-year-old amateur club status on Thursday.
results.shortTitle: Queen's Park to vote on amateur status
results.title: Queen's Park: Scotland's oldest club set to vote on ending 152-year-old amateur status

results.description: Preston North End boss Alex Neil explains his approach to management and players.
results.shortTitle: I've got players that have my work ethic - Neil
results.title: I've got players that have my work ethic - Alex Neil on Preston squad

results.description: Police Scotland investigates fan misbehaviour, including spitting at a match official, at Saturday's Scottish Championship game between Queen of the South and Ayr United.
results.title: Police Scotland investigates Ayr United fans after spitting at match official

results.description: Former Scotland forward Kevin Gallacher says players must "step up" their efforts to end the nation's 22-year wait for a major tournament.
results.title: Scotland players are not taking international duty seriously - Kevin Gallacher

results.description: Four uncapped players have been called up by Scotland Women head coach Philip Doyle for the upcoming Tests with Wales and Japan.
results.shortTitle: Malcolm named captain ahead of Tests
results.title: Scotland Women: Four uncapped players called up as Malcolm named captain

results.description: Austin MacPhee "has to be considered" for the Hearts manager's job, says former Tynecastle player Gary Mackay.
results.title: Hearts 'must consider' MacPhee, says club great Gary Mackay

results.description: Laura Muir hopes the addition of a world record to her British and European marks over 1000m in Glasgow can set herself up for next year's Olympics.
results.shortTitle: Muir targets Glasgow boost for Olympics
results.title: Laura Muir targets Glasgow Grand Prix boost for 2020 Tokyo Olympics

thumbnail.altText: Laura Muir well clear of the field in the European Indoor 1500m final in Glasgow

results.description: Live text and radio coverage of Scotland's penultimate Euro 2020 qualifying group match.
results.title: Euro 2020 qualifying: Cyprus v Scotland - live text & radio

results.description: BBC Alba coverage of the Scottish Challenge Cup quarter-final between Raith Rovers and Elgin City.
results.shortTitle: Watch: Raith Rovers v Elgin City
results.title: Watch: Raith Rovers v Elgin City - BBC Alba coverage

results.description: Hamilton were held to a 2-2 draw by 10-men Kilmarnock but one positive to come from the game was this incredible long-range goal from forward Mickel Miller.
results.title: Watch: Miller nets long-range thriller for Hamilton

results.description: Hearts comfortably overcame St Mirren 5-2 on Saturday, with the second goal coming from an unfortunate own goal by Sean McLoughlin in the first half.
results.shortTitle: Watch: St Mirren go behind to comical own goal
results.title: Watch: St Mirren go behind to a comical own goal against Hearts

thumbnail.altText: St Mirren go behind to comical own goal

results.description: Celtic consider a January move for former Bayern Munich midfielder Niklas Dorsch as Hearts welcome Steven Naismith's Scotland call-up after fitness talks.
results.title: Scottish Gossip: Celtic, Rangers, Hearts, Naismith, Hayes, Aberdeen, Motherwell, Kilmarnock, Gallagher, Dorsch, Heidenheim

results.description: Rangers remain level on points with Celtic at the top of the Scottish Premiership after beating Livingston at the Tony Macaroni Arena.
results.shortTitle: Rangers beat Livi to stay level at top
results.title: Livingston 0-2 Rangers: Steven Gerrard's side remain level at top of table

results.description: Odsonne Edouard opens the scoring and Richard Tait adds an own goal as Celtic beat Motherwell to remain top of the Premiership.
results.shortTitle: Celtic defeat Motherwell to stay top
results.title: Celtic 2-0 Motherwell: Champions win to stay top of the Premiership

thumbnail.altText: Odsonne Edouard celebrates opening the scoring at Celtic Park

results.description: Seven months after welcoming her son via emergency caesarean, Libby Clegg will compete at the World Para-Athletics Championships.
results.shortTitle: This is a bigger achievement - Clegg
results.title: World Para-Athletics Championships: Libby Clegg on motherhood and Dancing On Ice

thumbnail.altText: Libby Clegg with her T11 200m gold medal at the Rio 2016 Paralympics

results.description: Arbroath stun promotion-chasing Inverness CT with a thumping 3-0 win at Gayfield to move level on points with their opponents in the Scottish Championship.
results.title: Arbroath 3-0 Inverness CT: hosts cruise to shock win

results.description: Hamilton Accies let a two-goal lead slip at Kilmarnock after Sam Stubbs' red card but held on to secure a point.
results.title: Kilmarnock 2-2 Hamilton Academical: Ten-man Accies hold Kilmarnock

results.description: A Christian Doidge hat-trick inspires managerless Hibernian to just a second Scottish Premiership win of the season as they rout St Johnstone in Perth.
results.shortTitle: Doidge hat-trick powers Hibs to rout
results.title: St Johnstone 1-4 Hibernian: Christian Doidge hat-trick powers visitors to second league win

results.description: Alloa climb away from the foot of the Championship with a home win over Dunfermline.
results.shortTitle: Alloa off bottom after win over Dunfermline
results.title: Alloa Athletic 2-1 Dunfermline Athletic

results.description: Queen of the South pick up their first Championship win in four games by beating Ayr at Palmerston Park.
results.shortTitle: Queens beat Ayr to end losing run
results.title: Queen of the South 3-1 Ayr United

thumbnail.altText: Gary Oliver (right) celebrates with Stephen Dobbie against Dumbarton
